skill.name: torchdrug
skill.description: PyTorch-native graph neural networks for molecules and proteins. Use when building custom GNN architectures for drug discovery, protein modeling, or knowledge graph reasoning. Best for custom model development, protein property prediction, retrosynthesis. For pre-trained models and diverse featurizers use deepchem; for benchmark datasets use pytdc.
skill.summary: PyTorch-native graph neural networks for molecules and proteins. Use when building custom GNN archit...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 335 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill contains only markdown documentation for TorchDrug, a legitimate PyTorch-based ML library for drug discovery. Security patterns detected are misidentified scientific terminology: PyTorch model methods (eval) flagged as code evaluation, markdown code block syntax (backticks) flagged as shell execution, ML loss functions (bce, mse) flagged as cryptographic algorithms, dataset names (SAMPL, ZINC, BindingDB) flagged as C2/SAM infrastructure. No executable code or security risks present.

content.user_title: Apply TorchDrug for drug discovery with GNNs
content.value_statement: Build and train graph neural networks for drug discovery, protein modeling, and molecular property prediction. This skill provides comprehensive documentation for the TorchDrug library including datasets, model architectures, and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Guide molecular property prediction workflows using graph neural networks
Navigate TorchDrug datasets for drug discovery and protein modeling
Implement retrosynthesis planning with chemical reaction datasets
Train knowledge graph completion models for biomedical reasoning
Generate novel molecular structures with GNN-based generative models
Integrate TorchDrug with RDKit, AlphaFold, and PyTorch Lightning
limitations: This skill provides documentation reference only, not actual model training execution
Requires TorchDrug library installation and appropriate computational resources
Does not include pre-trained models or model weight files

use_cases.title: Predict molecular properties
use_cases.description: Predict solubility, toxicity, and binding affinity using GNN architectures like GIN and GAT

use_cases.title: Model protein structures
use_cases.description: Analyze protein sequences and structures with ESM and GearNet models for function prediction

use_cases.title: Plan synthesis routes
use_cases.description: Use retrosynthesis planning to design chemical synthesis pathways for target molecules

prompt_templates.title: Getting started
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I install TorchDrug and run a basic example for molecular property prediction?

prompt_templates.title: Dataset selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Which TorchDrug dataset should I use for training a model to predict blood-brain barrier penetration?

prompt_templates.title: Model architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the differences between GIN, GAT, and SchNet models in TorchDrug and when should I use each?

prompt_templates.title: Integration guide
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I integrate TorchDrug with PyTorch Lightning for distributed training of large-scale molecular models?

output_examples.input: How do I train a model to predict HIV inhibition?
output: Load the HIV dataset from TorchDrug: datasets.HIV()
Use a GIN model for molecular graph representation
Create a PropertyPrediction task with binary classification
Train using BCE loss and evaluate with AUROC

output_examples.input: What datasets are available for protein function prediction?
output: EnzymeCommission for EC number classification across 7 levels
Fluorescence for GFP protein intensity prediction

output_examples.input: How can I generate new drug-like molecules?
output: Use GCPN model for reinforcement learning-based generation
Set property constraints like logP and synthesizability
Validate outputs with RDKit for chemical validity

best_practices: Use scaffold splitting for molecular datasets to avoid data leakage
Start with small datasets like BACE or ESOL before scaling to larger ones
Combine property prediction with generative models for multi-objective optimization
anti_patterns: Do not use random splits for molecular property prediction - scaffold splits are more realistic
Avoid training without proper validation metrics like AUROC and AUPRC for imbalanced datasets
Do not skip RDKit validation when generating novel molecules

faq.question: What makes TorchDrug different from DeepChem?
faq.answer: TorchDrug focuses on PyTorch-native implementations and custom model development while DeepChem emphasizes pre-trained models and diverse featurizers.

faq.question: Which datasets are best for beginners?
faq.answer: Start with BBBP, BACE, or ESOL datasets. They are small, well-documented, and cover common drug discovery tasks.

faq.question: Can TorchDrug handle protein structure data?
faq.answer: Yes, TorchDrug supports AlphaFold PDB files and ESM embeddings for protein sequence and structure modeling.

faq.question: How do I generate new drug-like molecules?
faq.answer: Use GCPN or GraphAutoregressiveFlow models with property constraints for guided molecular generation.

faq.question: What GNN architectures are available?
faq.answer: GIN, GAT, GCN, RGCN, SchNet, GearNet, TransE, RotatE, and ComplEx for different data types and tasks.

faq.question: Does this skill run actual model training?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides documentation and reference guidance. Actual training requires installing TorchDrug and running Python code.
